Translation of 楚竹書・鬼神之明(en) into English.

p.seg: Now, ghosts and spirits have things that are made clear,
and things which are not made clear,
this is (regarding) their rewarding good and punishing violence.
In the past Yao, Shun, Yu and Tang were humane, righteous, saintly and wise,
and all under Heaven imitated them.
Therefore they deem valuable to be Son of Heaven,
and lucky to possess all under Heaven,
they reached old age and were famous,
and the later generations followed this.
So the reward of the spirits and ghosts,
that is now made clear.
Then came Jie, Zhou, You and Li,
who burned saints,
killed advisors,
plundered the one hundred surnames
and brought chaos to the state and the major families.
Then Jie was defeated at the Ge mountain
and Zhou bowed his head at the altars of Qi (?)
They did not reach their natural end,
and were despised by everyone under Heaven.
So [the punishment of the spirits and ghosts,
that is now made clear.]
(But) coming to Wu Zixu,
he was a saint under Heaven,
and yet was skinned alive [?] and died,
while duke Rong Yi,
who was a man disorder under Heaven,
reached old age and died a natural death.
If one wonders about it,
then (the fact is that) among the good people some are not rewarded,
among the violent people, [some are not punished].
Therefore because of this
I add that “ghosts and spirits have things that are not made clear”,
and this has necessarily its own reason.
